comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: From Pitt Street / Alfred Street corner. GoogleMapsStreetView I think the Pitt St / Castlereagh St tramway opened in 1903. It was a single line loop to Central Station, but I am finding conflicting information about which way round the trams trammed.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
[this is getting really geeky!] The tramway central "T"- pylons were replaced c.1908 to enable wider-bodied tramcars.

So after 1902 before 1908 so far ...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet/] Re. manholes (see notes) - surely for the Tank Stream?  There are covers there now - see the StreetView above where the girl is walking.

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Yes I agree, they are in precisely the right location for access to the Tank Stream. - www.creativespirits.info/oznsw/sydney/sitescbd/tankstream... [Kind of funny that in 7 years I've never noticed the Tank Stream markers!]
